posts.cooked: Hi guys, I was beginning tuning our arm mechanism today and it’s driven by 2 Falcons (TalonFX motors of course) with 1:200 Ratio gearboxes. I’d like it’s starting position to be read -0.2 rotations on boot, however the RotorOffset in the config only allows an offset between -1 and 1 which results in only -0.005 to 0.005 in the offset of the arm position feedback. Any solutions to that?

posts.name: sam liu
posts.cooked:
you can reset the arm position by executing this line:

BTW, because you are using relative encoders in the motor to sense the absolute position of an arm, it’s better to add a limit switch and execute the line every time the limit switch is pressed. Remember not to call the line periodically because it is thread-blocking and waits for 50ms on default. Good luck and see you in WRC!

posts.name: paulonis
posts.cooked: Just to clarify the answer above, setPosition() is a method in the TalonFXConfigurator class.   I’m guessing that you happened across methods in the FeedbackConfig class, which is not the right place to be looking to set the starting position of the internal relative encoder on the Falcons.

posts.name: sam liu
posts.cooked: Thanks for the correction. And I think you can simply call to the setPosition() method in the TalonFX class directly, which points to

posts.name: paulonis
posts.cooked: Not so much a correction, but just additional information.  Your clarification of my post is also valuable.  It is perfectly acceptable to call setPosition() on the TalonFX object as well as using the configurator.
Thanks a lot! I’ll try this out later. GL too! See you there in Beijing.

posts.name: shdalton
posts.cooked: Is there a simple way to reset the relative encoder of a Falcon using Phoenix 6?

posts.name: gcschmit
posts.cooked: Invoke setPosition(0) on the FalconFX controller.
